details.content: West Bengal CM & TMC Chief Mamata Banerjee arrives at 'United India' opposition rally.

West Bengal: Samajwadi Party Chief Akhilesh Yadav and DMK Chief MK Stalin received by CM Mamata Banerjee at 'United India' opposition rally, in Kolkata. pic.twitter.com/1FZbrIm3zK

— ANI (@ANI) January 19, 2019
"The last four years have been testing times for Indian democracy," says Gegong Apang, former Arunachal Pradesh CM

#UnitedIndiaAtBrigade @HemantSorenJMM says: "The manner in which the country is run, is dangerous for the nation"

WATCH LIVE >> https://t.co/IjQtPwzly7 pic.twitter.com/uzLYATkbUP

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019

details.title: Hardik Patel joins the rally
details.content: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel said while Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose had given a call to fight against the 'goro' (Britishers) "we are fighting against 'choro' (thieves)."

details.title: 'Mahagathbandhan' will ensure defeat of RSS and BJP: Jignesh Mevani
details.content: Dalit leader Jignesh Mevani said the coming together of so many opposition leaders at TMC's opposition rally gives a message for change in the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. The 'Mahagathbandhan' (Grand Alliance) will ensure the defeat of the RSS and the BJP, Mevani said, addressing the massive opposition rally at Brigade Parade Grounds here.
"This is not about removing one man from power. We have come together to defeat an ideology," says Former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha.
JMM leader Hemant Soren on Saturday called for "uprooting" the BJP from the country and said the opposition parties to give a "fitting" reply to the "communal" party in the next Lok Sabha polls.

details.title: The time for a coalition has arrived: Abhishek Singhvi
details.content:
#UnitedIndiaAtBrigade Rajya Sabha MP @DrAMSinghvi says: "Clouds are parting. A rainbow of political parties is forming. The time for a coalition has arrived"

WATCH LIVE >> https://t.co/IjQtPwzly7 pic.twitter.com/tlEm41z1YE

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019

details.title: Various jokers and lying artists coming together to destroy India again: Mukul Roy
details.content:
West Bengal is again witnessing a circus under @mamataOfficial’s rule similar to what Jyoti Basu had started. Various jokers and lying artists coming together to destroy India again. #UnitedAntiNationalsAtBrigade pic.twitter.com/A7XaOBg0ip

— Mukul Roy (@MukulR_Official) January 19, 2019

details.title: WATCH | Almost entire opposition join Mamata Banerjee’s ‘United India Rally’ in Kolkata
Over 20 leaders from more than 10 political parties are attending the rally. Among them are:
details.content:
• Andhra Pradesh CM and TDP chief Chandrababu Naidu
     
  • DMK head MK Stalin
  • Karnataka CM and JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy
     
  • JD(S) chief
     
  • Delhi CM and AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal
     
  • National Conference leaders Farooq Abdullah and Omar Abdullah
     
  • Tejashwi Yadav of RJD
     
  • Ajit Singh and Jayant Chowdhury of RLD
     
  • Former Arunachal Pradesh CM Gegong Apang
     
  • JMM leader Hemant Soren
     
  • Patidar movement leader Hardik Patel
     
  • LJD leader Sharad Yadav
     
  • Babulal Marandi of Jharkhand Vikas Morcha
     
  • Dalit leader Jignesh Mevani
     
  • NCP supremo Sharad Pawar
     
  • Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav
Former Chief Minister of Jammu & Kashmir, Farooq Abdullah, says: "The BJP is dividing people on the basis of religion. We must all come together to defeat the divisive forces"

details.title: Members of Bhutia community arrive at the rally
details.content:
Members of Bhutia community arrive at #UnitedIndiaAtBrigade rally pic.twitter.com/BofwT2jkDY

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019

details.title: The May general elections will be the second freedom struggle for us: MK Stalin
details.content:
#UnitedIndiaAtBrigade President of @arivalayam, @mkstalin says: "The upcoming general elections in May will be the second freedom struggle of the country"

WATCH LIVE >> https://t.co/IjQtPwzly7 pic.twitter.com/UFnIxMsu4h

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019

details.title: Modi is afraid of our unity: MK Stalin
details.content: "Wherever PM Modi is going he is fiercely attacking the Opposition, Modi is fearful of Opposition and that is why he is also cursing us, he is afraid of our unity, we must come together to safeguard India."

details.title: The BJP is lying to the people for votes: Satish Misra
details.content:
#UnitedIndiaAtBrigade @BSP4India MP Satish Misra says: "The BJP is lying to the people for votes. Unemployment is rising. Farmers, labourers, minorities, Dalits are being persecuted"

WATCH LIVE >> https://t.co/IjQtPwzly7 pic.twitter.com/FdHuJ1dno8

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019
"Regional have the strong instinct to connect with the people and protect the interests of their States," says HD Kumaraswamy.
I thank Mamata Banerjee for organising this grand alliance, there are people who thought this was not possible but we made it possible today: Akhilesh Yadav

details.title: Arvind Kejriwal: Those who PM Modi follows on Twitter insult women on social media

details.content: The Shah-Modi duo have destroyed the country, says the AAP convenor
2019 elections is not to find a new PM but to destroy the Shah-Modi combine: Kejriwal

details.title: United India Rally stage a show of unity
details.content:
#UnitedIndiaAtBrigade pic.twitter.com/2qIPhL1GVz

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019

Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu urges the people to save India, save democracy. He lists demonetisation as a 'political measure', calls GST a 'fraud scheme', saying that the government does not want economic improvement of the country.
The government of India is misusing RBI, CBI, ED and playing dirty politics: Chandrababu Naidu
2019 will see a new Prime Minister: Chandrababu reiterates what Akhilesh said

details.title: Your show of unity today is giving us hope: Sharad Pawar
details.content: The NCP chief says the leaders are here not for personal agendas but to fulfil the desires of the people, the farmers, the women and the Dalits of the country.

details.title: Save democracy, secular values and the Constitution of India which is being sabotaged by Modi and Shah: Mallikarjun Kharge
details.content: This rally marks an important attempt to galvanise leaders across the political spectrum, we are all here to fight the arrogant Modi government. That is the message given by Sonia Gandhi. I appeal to all to come together to save democracy, says Congress leader Kharge

Modi and Shah are helping their friends make profit at the cost of the nation's welfare, says Kharge raking up the Rafale fighter jet deal row again. He refers to the additional cost details of the deal which have come up in the media recently.

details.title: Mamata Banerjee calls on HD Deve Gowda, says he is not an 'accidental Prime Minister' but a 'famous PM'
Social media asking pertinent questions: Deve Gowda
details.content: Former PM HD Deve Gowda says a stable government is needed for the country right now. He refers to his short stint as PM with 13 coalition partners and the support of the Congress. He says: "Narendra Modi won 282 seats but what are we seeing today? He is destroying the secular and constitutional bodies of the country, this is his major achievement in last four years."

details.title: Shatrughan Sinha says he is a mirror to the BJP, trying to get them to see what they are doing

details.content: Shatrughan Sinha says, "Arun Shourie, LK Advani and Murali Manohar Joshi were not aware of demonetisation. Even the Finance Minister did not know. How then can it be called a decision made by the 'party'?"

Attacking the GST scheme, Sinha says, "Amendments to the GST is still happening. 8% one day, 12% one day. Why did you introduce the scheme? GST was hailed as a 'new freedom' for the country but ask the traders, chartered accountants, the temple priests, everyone? Everybody is affected by it. Rahul Gandhi said right, it is Gabbar Singh Tax."
A huge gap between promises and performances of the present government: Shatrughan Sinha
Sinha says, "We are being taken to Ayodhya just right before the elections, and when the matter is being debated in the Supreme Court. Why? It is to divert our attention from important issues."

details.title: We need to come together against Modi, who is a manufacturer of lies: RJD'S Tejashwi Yadav
details.content: Tejashwi Yadav says: We don't need a sword, but a needle to fix our country, right now. (Talvar nahi, sui ki zaroorat hai).

It's been more than three hours since #UnitedIndiaAtBrigade rally started. People are patiently sitting at the venue, listening to every speech by national leaders pic.twitter.com/afkFjAWI65

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019

details.title: TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee thanks the opposition leaders, begins her speech

details.content: Mamata Banerjee: You did not spare anyone, PM Modi, in your speeches? Not Sonia Gandhi, not me. Then why must we (opposition leaders) spare you?

details.title: No more acche din (good days) for the BJP anymore: Mamata Banerjee.
details.content: TMC supremo says, "The BJP got enough days to deliver acche din for the people but they did not care at all."

details.title: The mega opposition rally ends
details.content:
The historic #UnitedIndiaAtBrigade rally ends with the slogan "Badal do, badal do, Dilli mein sarkar badal do" pic.twitter.com/yfIyMZX9Zq

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) January 19, 2019

details.title: PM Modi terms anti-BJP rally as 'anti-people rally'
details.content:
Meanwhile, speaking at a rally in the Union Territory of Dadra & Nagar Haveli, Prime Minister Modi said: "They have not even properly united together, but have already started bargaining for their share (of seats). They are seeking support to save themselves, but I want your support to take the country forward."
